drKHJOV6S9JONoAWg483Tw.text: First time going to the buffet and Janice, our host, was so rude. She was not patient or understanding considering we've never been here before. Ruined the whole mood for the rest of the night.

MBQ1NCRq-nvoH7ZLgFTrhw.text: First visit here and I was happy enough with the variety/price/quality.  Came on a Saturday evening for a price of 19.99 each which includes the buffet and non-alcoholic beverage.  I'd say it was a good deal considering we usually spend about that for a dinner out.    The staff is very friendly.  We sat our receipt on the table as we made our way to the buffet and when we got back to our table, our drinks were sitting there ready for us.  Our server introduced herself and frequently checked to see if we needed refills on beverages and she was efficient in clearing our plates before we returned with newly loaded ones.  The variety was good I thought -- there are separate stations for different types of foods -- Italian, American, Salads, Asian, Desserts.  We asked waitstaff where we got plates and were given our instructions in a very friendly manner.  We immediately headed to the Asian station where a sushi chef helped us with salmon sushi and directed us to where we could get soy sauce and wasabi, then I loaded up on fried rice, some noodles, pork, and pot stickers and secured some chopsticks.  Next up was some salad, mashed potatoes, prime rib, and mixed vegetables.  Was too full for the Dessert section.    No complaints at all.

hQcxJbySnO023ZdR9zbvSA.text: Coming from East Texas. We travel quite a bit and always stop at the casinos and get a players card and have the buffet. I must say this was the worst one I've been to. It was cheap, buy one get one free. And it's a good thing because the food was not good. Other than the prime rib which was cut up in hunks, the next best thing was Salisbury steak. Which felt like it came out of a TV dinner. I will say that the desert bar was good and they had a really good ice cream selection. Gambling was what you expect from a casino. Win a little lose a lot.

hg5S2vFyj-8cG3IKmX_p4w.text: Buffet was very good. My only complaint is against myself because it was a buffet I gave small tip, but my waitress Katie was on top of refilling our drinks and I could see she was running around like crazy and I wished I had left more,  but I paid with a card and there was no way to give more. They had a good variety of food and they had like 8 different types of ice cream at the dessert section of the buffet,  which I thought was impressive because most buffets only have a chocolate/ vanilla dispenser.   I would go back for sure.  The service was good and even though there was a long line we still got seated promptly.  There was even a bar area for customers who wanted an adult beverage.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My hodge podge of buffet food

oh0AZZw2KPOayFfUdxl5iA.text: Very good buffet. Just about everything I tried I liked a lot!! Love the BBQ, Italian, Chinese and dessert stations. Pulled pork, chili, and creme brulee are my favorites.

7QzWsiEI2IE8YfniKAzjHg.text: I wish I could give this half a star.This buffet is not very good. You have to pay extra for crab legs and alcohol.But the only kinda nice/ok thing was the Mongolian area where you pick your veggies and sauces and they cook it with the meats you pick.   I think you can get better and more plentiful food from golden corral. My wife and i only ate there cause it was free for getting a players card. I would never eat there again ever. It was bland. The selections were blah not tasty or that fresh. Our waitress was very good though.

VOE7RD8ablGl_SPp2RRNMg.text: Hmm... the line took way too long, but the food was worth the wait. I only like buffets at casinos. The desserts were out of this world. Staff at front seat and the seaters were to slow. Waitresses were hustling

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

esDeGqmay3CGZW7UPHJ0Bg.text: Wow, Pittsburgh has had its share of great buffets, including the Grand Concourse, Hokkaido, the former Misaki and Tokyo Sushi Buffets, but Grand View Buffet is at the other end. I would dare Rivers Casino managers to eat there. There are a couple edible things but many that definitely aren't. There was a pot of "mussels marinara" and each mussel was shriveled literally to the size of a pencil eraser; they had obviously been cooked too long and sat in heat and air shriveling and shriveling for hours. "Stir fry" was looking pretty gray. "Pasta" dishes looked like and probably were just frozen stuffed shells with tomato paste dumped on top. And they too sat and sat, getting crustier with each passing hour. It's really hard to find anything worth eating despite the $20 price, and that's really sad. On the carving station, the "prime rib" was ok, but overcooked. The turkey looked completely overcooked and dry, I wouldn't even sample it. So some well-done prime rib, a little cottage cheese, a little macaroni and cheese, a couple pierogis, and some gelato, and a couple pieces of very badly made sushi with gummy sticky rice pressed way to hard into a dense chewy roll. That's not much of a dinner for $20 in Pittsburgh. Do yourself a favor, eat pretty much anywhere else either before or after a visit to the casino. Oh, side note. You can order a pound of crab legs for an additional $7. I didn't but they did actually look good, fresh and hot, unlike the other items on the buffet, but certainly no better than the crab legs at TJ Buffet that come with the $18 buffet versus this combination that Grand View will charge you $27 for.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Frozen stuffed shells with tomato paste straight from the can.
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Stir fry with broccoli turning from green to gray.

G7X41H7_KxqXxx-LtJfopQ.text: I came here a couple times when the casino first opened and at the time I was a vegetarian. I don't recall having difficulty putting a quality meal together and always felt happy and full when I left.  I stopped coming because I'm just not a fan of the casino, in particular having to walk through the cigarette smoke infested room to get to your dining destination.   Well, fast forward to now, my dad and I were brainstorming where to go for Easter Brunch, which was fairly last minute at the time. We decided on this buffet. It was pretty fantastick and they had a great variety of foods. However, I noticed there were hardly any vegetables. And in fact, some of the ones ingot were dug out of other dishes.    I went again to take my dad for Father's day and there was a remarkable difference in both the quality and the selection of food items. Everything seemed a little more fast food-y and there was not a single veggie dish to be had (admittedly, there is the salad bar, but I am referring to cooked veggies).  In fact, the only veggies I was able to obtain on this visit were the ones I pulled out from other meat-centric dishes. While I'm no longer a vegetarian, I still love and want my vegetables.  Came again last night and again, the food screamed of low quality junk and thisntime there was ONE veggie dish they with sauteed zucchini, squash, and peppers, but it was hard as a rock. Now they did put a fresh one out later that was significantly better but seriously, when you're only offering ONE veggie dish, make it right.  I don't know. For the cost and the number of people feeding themselves there, I don't see why it needs to be so hit or miss, and also why the quality has to be so sub par.

MZVk8HuOQmNYFoUV4-iRHQ.text: Pretty good buffet. I really enjoyed the Philly and California rolls. The meat cutting station was tasty and the meat was moist and cooked just right. They have plenty to offer from pizza to Mongolian. The real treat is the dessert area. They are all small portions but all well made and enjoyable. They have a great selection of gelato, cakes and pies.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gelato station
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NvlP1c_MsFGwfRdNk-kZqA.text: This buffet is upstairs at the Rivers Casino.  You go upstairs through to the second level where you can see the river, it's the best part.  The buffet is $20 and it changes depending on the holiday.  The buffet has a salad bar, Italian,  Asian, American, Meat and dessert section.  You can pay extra for seafood and alcohol.   The buffet is 50/50 half the food is good the other half is nothing great.  Some of the Italian is good, Make your own stir fry was flavorless,  the meats were good my meat was tender, the desserts are OK but they have Italian ice cream that's good.  If you want to pig out on $20 this buffet is ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Desserts
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meats
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish and pierogies

XtcqlI4LquR0t9OBkkpYuQ.text: I've been here a few times but most recently just this past week before I was going to a concert at Stage AE. Right now there's a buy one get one promotion on Wednesdays during May. So the value was pretty awesome since it was basically $10 a person.  The food is pretty good, and the desserts are wonderful. The service was great. Our server was on the ball and kept our drinks refilled. All of the servers said hello anytime they saw us.  I particularly enjoyed the Mongolian Barbecue station. It was awesome being able to pick out exactly what I wanted to have cooked up.  The sushi options were legit and I loved the pot stickers, too.  Just like most buffet places, the food can get a little dry if it's been sitting there for a while. We experience that a little bit since we went there for dinner around 4 p.m. but overall it was very enjoyable.  We also loved the option of sitting outside.

f4Gpnu7vqQPeyQkzRj8wSQ.text: The buffet was excellent when they first opened and crab legs prime ribs and higher quality foods was included in the price of the meal and even on sunday there was an option for all you can drink included.  All of that is long gone.  The food here is on par of a golden corral now and not as much fresh fruits and vegetables they have.  Lines entering can be long especially with vouchers and sales but if I had to pay full price I wouldn't bother. They need to have more cashiers or make the process more efficient it is normal for the line to be over 100 people long sometimes.  The service here sometimes can be slow only in clearing plates but you can get a nice view of the river

KgTsiBEU-OMvVxcQUrLOWA.text: This is the first time I have been to the casino buffet since Mother's Day. I used to come here a lot when they used to have the all you can eat crab legs. I must say the quality and selection has taken a deep dive down hill. We happened to be at the casino for the wine fest and decided to eat here (there were six of us). I started off with the salad bar where check was pretty good. The buffet selection was horrible. All of us got our plates sat down and just stared. Was not happy with the selection or taste. We immediately got the manager and asked for a refund and went downstairs to the wheelhouse which is much better. That's a shame too. We used to come here all the time. Hopefully the Sunday brunch hasn't changed. I rate this a one....only because I do like the salad bar.

c8Nffb0lZ93CjvbVRjyOSg.text: Nice place for Saturday or Sunday brunch .  Bottomless coffee or soft drinks.  Nice window view of Pittsburgh.  Great place to relax and spend time with friends.

fIm7-yNtx-HfWUsmtQesdw.text: Came here for the first time and had their weekend brunch for $15 per person.  What's Hot - Variety.  There's something for everyone.  There's Italian (with pastas, pizza rolls), sushi, Mongolian BBQ, a gelato bar, good variety of desserts, omelette station, etc...  There are a decent amount of veggie options, as well.  It's a casino buffet, so the variety is pretty good. - Price.  $14.99 for weekend brunch buffet, which is a very good price.  For the amount of food that you get, it's a pretty good tradeoff.   - Quality.  Hubby said their gelato is good.  I'm disappointed that I didn't get a chance to try the gelato bar.  I had some of their desserts, but didn't have enough room for the gelato.  The best desserts we tried were their baklava, cheesecake, and creme brulee.  Their omelettes are pretty good, too.     - Service.  Staff are nice; checked in regularly to make sure we had what we needed; and refilled our drinks accordingly.     - View.  I specifically asked for a table by the window with a view.  Definitely great and helped our group enjoy our meal that much more.  What's Not - Quality.  It's not the best food.  I've had better.  You're not paying for the quality of the food, you're paying for the volume and variety of food.  It's hit or miss, depending on what you pick.  For example, their sushi isn't the best.  Their sushi falls apart easily/isn't wrapped tightly and the flavor isn't very good.  Their Mongolian BBQ does NOT include noodles among your choices, which is something I've never come across before for Mongolian BBQ.  Their Asian dishes are not very well flavored and are pretty bland.  It looks like a lot of their food sits out for quite a while and is sometimes overcooked/too dry.  The food isn't bad, but it's not great.  It's not very flavorful and can be pretty bland, so be prepared for that.  Final Answer Willing to come back, but not a first choice.  Good value for money, but not the best quality food.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sushi bar

OB3pgzKpv2xB4a4Z-XC61A.text: This my first time to the grand view buffet at the casino. We were pleasantly surprised. It was not busy when we were there. They had many different types of food at different stations: Italian Mongolian Asian American Barbecue  Desert We both got a salad and the options for toppings were great and fresh.  My husband went for the American and barbecue. The kielbasa was great and then he also liked the potato skins, bbq chicken and sides. I had the Mongolian. Everything I had I liked the potstickers, spring rolls , beef. The fried rice was ok but much better when I added the sauce from the beef.  The deserts were so pretty! There was a hot chocolate truffle that was amazing and the peanut butter gelato yumm! I could've eaten the whole tub!  We will definitely be coming back to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A few deserts from the buffet

d2sI_XxF9C5GPqsv2aOEkg.text: Let me preface my review saying I have only been here for the Sunday brunch so the weekday and evening buffet option probably differ.   The positives of this buffet are that there are lots of choices! A salad bar with soups is in the center of the buffet area. There is then a wall of different selections from one side of the room to the next: American, Asian, Mediterranean, Italian as well as a whole area dedicated to desserts. Now while I do enjoy having a lot of selections, a majority of the food is just mediocre at best. A lot of it is over cooked or under seasoned. I tend to stick with most of my tried and True favorites when I go, such as the cheese blintzes! Also the sushi is terrible! I'm a huge sushi fan but Grandviews reminds me of the horrible convenience store type of sushi. Stay far away! A place to come if your hungry but be prepared to fill up on average food.

xjUQqPwyIpn3nCRps5WtZQ.text: I think you may have to call to make sure the prime rib is available. They ran out of prime rib without telling us after we paid.

q7J8OA2yArzaJPRDmbJZHg.text: I've heard about this place for a while, glad we were able to check it out! First, we arrived directly after a Steeler game. It was PACKED! So please note that my review is based on the fact that the buffet had 10,000 people there (must be a good thing, right?)  So the line to get in, TIP - if you have a card through the casino, you can pretty much skip the line (nice!) If not, plan to wait a few minutes if it is busy.  The restaurant itself has an AMAZING view of the city, the river, and the point state park (can't beat that)  I was impressed with the size of the buffets. There was a good bit of food for just about everyone. However, I couldn't get past the "Golden Corral Vibes" sure no one has heard that in a while, but it's True! Everything was very "American-ized" with Butter, cheese, etc. It would have been great to have a few vegan/non dairy selections available.   The buffet ranged from Asian, to Italian so there is definitely something for everyone.  I think my favorite part was definitely the dessert bar, they even had gelato!   Service was horrible, I think our waitress stopped by once. We had plates sitting around forever - no refills, etc. Like I said though, the place was jam packed.   I would be curious to check out the buffet on a not so busy Sunday.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Busy day
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Asian

wQ9bUTnrKsJEeIkRNVN5Ag.text: Variety! This buffet has something for everyone. Soft drinks/coffee included. If you're there before 2:30 many days it's less than $15 per person. Service is always great.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View from the table
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dining room

VyvQ_zsHkVvfUkyKhZA2JQ.text: Yo, this is a place that you will have a love/hate relationship with for a multitude of reasons.  You all know me, I never pass up a chance to gorge myself at a buffet, so when the better half suggested this place, I was down.  The pricing seems hefty for dinner, but in actuality, it's about the same price as going to a fancy restaurant and leaving hungry.  $20 for a dinner buffet isn't bad.  With the many different cuisine stations, there is no way to leave this place hungry.  Once you make your way through the paying process (you can leave a tip beforehand so in your after gorged state you can waddle out) you are escorted to a table, most times of your choice and set free to roam the range...I mean buffet.  Of course, and with any buffet I go to, I stopped at the salad station first.  Nice variety of vegetables and toppings of your choice.  You can easily fill up on salad here if you want.  I especially like that you aren't stuck with just iceberg lettuce as your base.  You also have your choice of the cold salads, i.e. potato, pasta, macaroni, Cole slaw, pickled beets and so forth.  After you finish with your salad then comes the daunting task of picking which way to attack the rest of the buffet.  You can start at one of the ends and make your way in the other direction or just go HAM on it and load that plate up like you're at an eating contest.  I took the first choice there.  I started at the barbecue end and made my way in the direction of foods.  I won't go into everything I ate here as it is a wide array of food.  Some of the food was amazing, some of it not so much.  The mac and cheese could have used something to make it less thick and maybe some type of seasoning.  The fried ravioli...change those things out if they are as hard as a brick!  I picked some up and topped them with some sauce and my knife could not cut through them.  I think that was a major problem here.  It was slow so the food selection didn't get changed out too quickly allowing the food to sit under the heating lamps and dry out.    Deserts were amazing.  I especially loved the chocolate chip cookies.  One suggestion here, and my better half also thinks this of the warm chocolate cake, have those little cartons of milk available.  I really could have gone for some milk with those cookies.  Even with that a few mishaps let's just say that I left here with my stomach distended and made myself uncomfortable for the rest of the evening and well into the early morning hours.  To touch on what I said at the beginning, I love that this is a buffet, I just hate how I feel for hours after I ate at this buffet.

lJRJstjFz8MzKXBo5j70nQ.text: I was home for the holidays, so I decided to meet up with my friends for brunch. We decided on the buffet in the casino because it has so many options. We all wanted mimosas as well m, so this was perfect.  For brunch, mimosas are $1 each or $6 for a pitcher. I decided to get two for now since they said one pitcher is about 6 mimosas so it is the same price. I am glad I only ordered two, because the mimosas did not taste like they had much champagne on them. I asked the waiter if he could go easier on the orange juice and he suggested just getting champagne. It was only a dollar too! I wish I would have known that from the beginning lol  The buffet itself has a lot of variety. You can get a made to order omelette, desserts, steak, waffles eggs. They also have cultural food like Asian and Italian. Don't forget the salad bar :-)   For the price of brunch and the amount of food you receive, I would definitely come back here on my visit home.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

UHKnr-kD_kTk-KzkrkpIGA.text: I came here mainly for the crab legs; and to experience the delicious options this buffet had to offer. I came with a coworker of mine and we went to every different type of buffet selection. I tried so many different dishes I can't list everything. But the crab legs were definitely worth it as they satisfied my craving. I will most definitely return here in the future if I'm ever near by this location. Overall, the food was great and the staff were friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The prices
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The decor right before coming into the buffet
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The entrance

_ABufcVOfOtCsLoi_0pu1w.text: I got to say I was definitely impressed with all the options  and the desert bar was so good I could have just eaten that . The only recommendation I have is for them to have the omelette line separate. It held up the buffet for  the people  that just wanted stuff all ready made .

bwyOQ1oULTphggH_VPtecw.text: Went here with some people from work for the lunch buffet and was happy to see that they were offering a BOGO deal. Lunch is normally $14.99 including your drink so not bad at all.  They have a lot of options from American Classics to made for you Mongolian BBQ. I loved the fact that they had sushi as well. It was decent for a buffet. Nothing too special here but decent (Spicy Tuna, Salmon Cucumber, California Roll, etc.) I stuck with mostly the Asian options sampling the Sushi, General Tso's Shrimp, Pot Stickers and Fried Rice. All good. I also went for the Mongolian BBQ which is made to order. You select your ingredients and sauce. The Szechuan Beef with Peppers, Onions, Mushrooms and Bean Sprouts was very tasty. I really enjoyed their actual salad bar as well. Everything appeared very fresh and there were many options. In fact, I wish they offered an option for just the salad bar itself at a lower cost.  This is a good option if you are looking for a buffet in the area. It's going to be a step above a Golden Coral in quality and options but not fine dining by any means.  I have to mention the view of the river as well. It is very nice.  Check it out for yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Schezuan  Beef with Peppers, Onion, Mushrooms and Bean Sprouts
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mongolian BBQ
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sushi, General Tso&#39;s Shrimp, Pot Stickers, Fried Rice, Spring Roll

bnQubfd3j3mGJeOQ0b-ReQ.text: My motto in life is quantity not quality - at least when it comes to food. If you're starving but not exactly sure what food you're in the mood for, throw on your stretchy pants and come to Grand View. What I love is that they offer a little bit of everything. Whether you're in the mood for pizza, pasta, sushi, or just 50 scoops of gelato, they'll have it. It's about $20 a person which is slightly more expensive than alternatives. The quality of the food is not great, honestly. As with most buffets, food left out can get dry or stale. I'm the biggest sushi nut, but their sushi is horrendous. I personally enjoy the brunch buffet because 1) it's cheaper and 2) more vegetarian friendly options.   Don't forget to cash in on your free meal on your birthday!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Birthday Cake Waffle!

3S-ZP2nBLkG81NS9lkTwag.text: We ate at the Grand View Buffet years ago when it first opened, it was really simple, plan, yet very good.   Our last visit was excellent. It was the last evening for the BOGO. The line to get in was a mile long but so worth it.   Every station was well stocked, hot dinner plates and eager cooks to help. Food was properly prepared very tasty & delicious !!  All the station had something for everyone's taste. The dessert station was over flowing with awesome treats.   I enjoyed the salad station and the Asian station.   The dining room was full in every chair, it it was easy to move around the stations.   As we finished our dinner and left for the evening the line to get in was as long as when we first arrived.   I have been to many casino buffets in Vegas and Atlantic City as well as Canada and beyond, it isn't as lavish, but Rivers Casino Grand View Buffet offers excellent food at a good price. The add ones are pricy but worth it. The cocktail bar offers liquors and wine at a reason price as well.   Highly recommend and we will return !!

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

xYes9PqxHbEDPPy5r1eZEQ.text: The buffet is reasonably priced for the variety and quality of food that they offer. I have eaten here for the lunch, dinner, and brunch buffet on numerous occasion. It is very hit or miss in my opinion. The quality is amazing at times, while other times I have been very disappointed. They have a nice variety of food to choose from and a large selection of desserts.    The brunch buffet has $1 mimosas, which is a plus in my book.   I definitely will return when I am gambling at the casino and looking for a hearty, filling meal.

guG7UWNzWxIiZNiRg7drBg.text: Great buffet. Possibly the best in Pittsburgh. While not on the scale of Las Vegas or Atlantic City casino buffets, this buffet is really good and I always look forward to having the latest selections. I will be back for sure!

T1H1j7teX55zJUjQLdTGBQ.text: I've been here several times an usually it's a decent experience. I went this last weekend and was pretty disappointed. The food choices were not the greatest. They took scallops off of the Mongolian menu. They used to have sushi now they only have rolls. We went around 5:30 and all the food seemed like it had been sitting out for a while. I actually didn't make it out of the parking garage before running back into the building straight to the bathroom. The only positive thing I can say is that the Creme Brulee was delicious.

pQGPV62i7E09f6jIE5dx1Q.text: We were in the mood for some crab legs so we decided to give the buffet at the casino another try. There was a time about 3 years ago when it was really good. We stopped going because the food started getting really bad. I think taking the crab legs off the buffet and having them as an add on really killed the business so now all the food is dried up and gross because there is no turn over. We did add on the crab legs and they were really good. The prime rib was also very good, but the rest was gross. I have to mention the sushi, they seriously throw the sushi in a bin, it is all mixed up just tossed together like a salad. I really have never seen any thing quite like it.  This was our last visit, we will not give them another chance. One good thing about the buffet, it's one of the only buffers you leave without over eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZCQPN0qFGJ59F268eWTQPw.text: I am actually very pleasantly surprised of the experience I had here. I would not pay this much for buffet normally, I saw their special deal for rush reward members can eat buy one get one free Monday thru Thursday. Therefore, me and my boyfriend came on a week day. We forgot our rush reward member card and the lady insists without physically seeing the card they wouldn't get us a discount. I went down to the player service to get a replacement of the card and we successfully got in.  For me, the highlight of the experience is their desserts. OMG, everything in the dessert section is so tasty, I got way too much desserts. The food selection was great, from salad bar, to American food, Asian food, Mongolian stir fry, and Italian. Everything was good but nothing is outstanding I guess. The service was great, and efficient. I would definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Grand View Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yuuum

vgV5ghCDqGJX0lkTa3qMtQ.text: Join the Rivers Club and you'll receive a free buffet on your birthday and a coupon for a buy-one-get one. I went here with my family for my sisters birthday. It's huge inside so the line goes fast if they have one at all. The buffet is organized by section: Italian, Asian, American...   I love to try some from each section. My favorite is the sushi bar and stir-fry. The stir-fry is made to order. The sushi is pre-made, but they have a variety of rolls even vegetables ones for me! I also love the carving station. The turkey is always very juicy as my sister loves the prime rib. Don't forget to stop by the desert table for the mocha no bake cheesecake.

c9zZfdOvpjmNFdm8tSER-g.text: The food was ok. I ordered the crab legs for an extra $7. When we were seated, I asked the server immediately if I could wait a little while for my crab legs because I wanted to get a plate first. She said absolutely, she wouldn't put in the order until I asked for them. So I got my salad plate of 4 things and sat down and bam, there was another girl with my crab legs. They were waterlogged and barely warm. The butter was cold. I gave my husband one and he said they taste funny, do you think they are overdone. I said I am not sure but they are bad. So this other girl came by and was cleaning up beside us and said hi and asked me if everything was ok. I said yes and then asked her if she was the manager and she said no but she could get him.  He came over and I wanted to explain to him about how I thought they might be bad but as soon as I said I think there is something wrong, he said, well what as I can't exactly see when there isn't much left there.  THERE was more than half left.  Then he said, I can't comp you on something that isn't there. I said, wow, I didn't want you to comp anything and he THEN SAID to me, well we did have a problem with the crab legs tonight and had to get some from the restaurant downstairs and I said well no wonder because they are bad. I said I am so sorry I bothered you, I just wanted you to know they were bad. Then 1/2 hour later I got so sick and spent the next 40 minutes in the bathroom. Never going back there and didn't spend a penny in their casino either!  Next time Mr. "Manager" you should listen to what your customer is trying to tell you!  Hope not to many people got sick for lousy crab legs.

EDBSLo3eHT1JPqo6WA3DeQ.text: We ate  t the buffet with a large party( 35ish)  for the Sunday Brunch. I was trying to contact them to make a reservation but they do not accept reservations.  When we arrived there was a HUGE line, however it went quickly( about 20 minutes) and the staff  was able  to seat us all in one section! I was happily impressed.  They seemed to assign  additional waitstaff to us as we were never with out  beverages( including the mimosas!) and the plates were always cleared.   On to the food.. OH MY the food: prime rib, turkey, ham, stir fry, pizza, salads, peel and eat shrimp, crab legs,made to order omelets, bacon, eggs, pastas, etc.. so many wonderful and fresh choices. Then there is a whole  table of desserts in small bite portions!    One thing to note- when you have a large party they will automatically  add an 18% gratuity, which was no big deal for us as they deserved more!

hvS1dYazNncbIGOZZZVjKg.text: Went to the casino for the first time on Friday, the 20th , for the sole purpose of having the buffet. What a mistake! For over $42.00 (paid for a friend) I encountered food not fit for the garbage dump. There was not one item that was not old, cold or dry. Only one seafood item, an awful looking mess, labeled tilapia. Apparently, the price for this swill has been fluctuating over the past few months and seems to be missing the mark. The quality of this buffet puts it squarely in the $8.99 to $10.99 range depending on how many items are actually edible. I cannot believe Rivers Casino would allow this embarrassment to exist. In comparison, Golden Corral is fine dining. I mentioned the poor quality to our "server" and she agreed it was bad and business has fallen off considerably. Rather than bringing the manager to the table she suggested I find him on the way out if I wished to complain. I didn't bother since I wasn't looking for a freebie and if the manager remotely cared the situation wouldn't exist in the first place. If you plan on going to the casino, for the buffet,  do yourself a favor and eat somewhere else. Anywhere else!!!

U7F_RHI3TJ22bXi4C1YNKA.text: The food was very good for the money but the stench of the cigarette smoke billowing up from the casino is disgusting. Not sure if the dining experience is worth going home smelling like a filthy ashtray.

oroz5NLqGVoYyEAvUpSfow.text: Yesterday after my bf and I had some good soul food at church, we ventured to the Grandview Buffet with friends of ours for brunch. For some reason, I have been to every restaurant at the casino EXCEPT for the buffet, and I definitely wasn't disappointed. There were so many different options to pick from and there was something for everyone. The crab legs were exceptional, and I was a fan of the Italian fritatta (reminded me of my uncles making it for a family breakfast feast) along with the healthy veggie options everywhere! I would definitely go back, but maybe not until I work off the 5 pounds I gained yesterday!! :)

sGVB7NoJIlpKwzlpp9rFfg.text: I love the grandview buffet for the Asian Wok! The noodles and vegis on the Wok are amazing!

XG8FHjfUViqED0xG5R2meg.text: Rivers casino grandview buffet- mediocre, over-priced food. Same menu for four years no change in menu items or presentation of food. Do not waste your money. Why is it you think they give free booze on Sundays? Cheap food costs.

XRg2WYTy2c7-baFhrPpnnw.text: The buffet costs $20 including a soft drink. Good selection of foods that range from average to better than average. Nothing outstanding. Main courses ranged from pastas, Chinese, Crab legs and salads.  Crab legs are snow crab. Lots of work. Some of the Chinese food was good. Steamed dumplings were good. Ribs needed more spices and some sauce on the side. Some of the pasta was good, some did not look worth tasting. "prime"rib was cooked properly and pretty good for a buffet.  Deserts were good. Warm chocolate cake was tasty. Creme Berle was good. Gelato was not outstanding but pleasant.

2rrMcymVlgDyAFO7hHM-_A.text: I've been to the Grandview Buffet a couple times for breakfast and once for dinner, and frankly I'm surprised at the poor/inconsistent food quality. At the breakfast buffet there was plenty of food, but none of it was very appealing, several trays of scrambled eggs were cooked inconsistently. One tray was runny, another rubbery. Sausage patties seemed to have been boiled, none of them was significantly browned. Bacon on the other hand was nearly all burnt in one tray, yet flaccid in another. And there weren't any lighter foods on the buffet (fruit salad would have been a nice alternative), only two types of sausage, bacon, scrambled eggs, cold toast, and sweet pastries. Dinner however was worse. BBQ items were tasteless (no rub, no sauce, no salt...) but heavy on the artificial-tasting  smoke flavor, which was quite unpleasant. There were only a few kinds of sushi, they were small and not very appealing. Italian pasta dishes looked dried up and neglected, though it wasn't a wierd hour or very late, only 6pm. Oddly they had a man working full time behind the salad bar and a woman working behind the pastry bar, despite very little business at those two stations. All in all I had the impression that the place is run to visually impress people rather than to have consistently wonderful food. I doubt their chefs and managers would want to eat at this buffet.
